reviewText:
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Whist I recommend the gameplay it's self, I do not recommend buying this title, as it's broken.

I have made a ticket asking Steam to Put a warning up so people do not buy this version...
like me...and waste good money that could be spent on a working Beat Em Up.

The game it's self is marvelous! It's pure greatness, as you'd expect from SF!....But....

1) The game doesn't work unless you rename a file in the game directory (The fix is at the end of my review)

2 ) Once you've sorted that and launch the game...you can play fine....but.you are unable to save any progress, because Games for Windows Live is dead. So any characters you unlock are lost...

I am so dissapointed by this purchase. I really was looking forward to spending a few nights unlocking content, but not like this...
One can only hope Steam do something to fix this fiasco =(

Personal rating: Great game, crappy services embedded into it ruining it
Percent Rating: 95% if it worked properly, but as it stands 5%....
---------------------------
The fix to make the game launch below...

1) Go to the game folder  C:\SteamLibrary\SteamApps\common\Street Fighter IV
2) Find the file in that folder StreetFighterIV.exe.cfg
3) Change it's name toStreetFighterIV.exe.cfg.BAK
4) Then try to launch as normal, it should work.
5) If that doesn't work, install GFWL from the exe in that same folder and try again.
6) Enjoy your game till you realise you can't save progress
7) OPTIONAL STEP: Curse profusely at the fact you spent good money on a broken game...:

reviewText:
Difficulty: Just Right
The Bottom Line: Highly Addictive/Superb
Score: 9.0

Note: This Game Been Tried Out And Reviewed In Offline Mode or On Another Steam Account And Or Consoles.

Street Fighter 4 is a fantastic action game.
Those who are new to Street Fighter genre will also find this game addictive.

For beginners, Training mode
Command list which explains the moves & combos of each character is easy to understand & learn.
Challenge Mode includes Time Attack, Survival & Trial Mode.
SF4 has 25 characters which include old ones like Ryu, Ken, etc. & new ones like Rufus, C.Viper, El.Fuerte, etc. & two Secret characters i.e. Akuma & Gouken.

Gouken [Shen Long] is the elder brother of Akuma [Gouki] & teacher of Ryu.
New feature includes the Ultra Combo i.e. Revenge Gauge

This game is actually 2D rendered in 3D graphics. Controller/Joystick is recommended
Playing this game only with a keyboard can be tough & troublesome.

Overall: a fantastic game & Highly recommended.

reviewText:
If you're a fan of the Street Fighter franchise it is mandatory for you to pick this one up. At this point it might be better to purchase Super Street Fighter IV as it offers a bigger rooster. Also, Ultra Street Fighter IV is scheduled to be released this year around the summertime.

There are not many old-school fighter games on PC these days. You have the remade Mortal Kombat, too, so there isn't really anything else out there for us PC gamers. Just make sure you have a controller as with the keyboard it is a pain in the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• to play the game.

Interestingly, the story takes place right after Street Fighter II ended. Chronologically, the game can be put between the 2nd and 3rd episode. Bison's Shadaloo organisation still exists and organises another tournament to gather the best fighters in the world - this time, however, instead of Bison you have Seth as the final boss. Seth combines the best moves of all the players out there - he has a lot of counter special attacks, very agile and overall a pain on harder difficulty settings.

Gradually, you can learn to fight with each SF character and can continue to play online. You need a lot of time and effort to master these fighters. You can unlock many more as you progress through the game.

Overall, this is a really good game. When I was young my parents bought me Street Fighter II for the Super NES so for me this game was instantly captivating.

reviewText: A seriously fun game, when all you want is a quick fight, nothing beats this game, unless Super Street Fighter IV is released for PC.

Street Fighter IV has classic fighter roots and mixes it up with its own tweaks and twists. The combat is really fun, I always keep coming back for more. If you have no friends the A.I. put up such a great challenge that i could play them all day without end.  I recommend this game to anyone who loves a good fighter. Just careful this game has tendancy to cause blisters on your fingers because you just cannot stop playing

This is the title that jumped the franchise again. Although it's only the vanilla version and you'll be better off with the Arcade one or just waiting for the Ultra Street Fighter 4 that's coming out next year, it's still a gem of fighting games. Brings back old memories spamming Hadokens and Dragon Punches! I'm not going to say I'm a good player at this, but it is fun in the end. Get it if you don't want to pay so much for the Arcade version or the Ultra that's coming out next year.

Ultimately, though, get it when it's on sale. It makes it worth it. $20 for a fighting game that's having so many other versions isn't that much of a deal.

8/10 when it's on sale. (:
5.5/10 if not. /:

reviewText: One of the best fighting games since a long time. The graphics are beautiful, just beau-ti-ful and the fighting is fluid. I HATE the pop song that plays in the main menu and I HATE Seth. That cheap ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. I've only been able to defeat him using Zangief so far. With my amazing, god-like skills mind you. One thing I hate as well is, in case of Zangief, that I never seem to be able to pull off his Ultra combo. He ALWAYS performs his Super. What's up with that ? Like I can't press the same button 3 times in a row really fast. No, I'm not physically challenged. Dear SFIV, I spit on you ! ... ... No, I didn't mean that ! Come back, please ! Fine, fine, I'll be playing Super Street Fighter IV then. Let's see how that works out...\n\n[Rating: 80/100]

reviewText:
i do not recommend this game.

first of all i have to say that street fighter IV is probably the best fighting game you can play , i have
in my library few more fighting games such as:

injustice gods amond us
the king of fighters xiii
mortal kombat kollection
mortal kombat komplete edition

and street fighter iv got the best gameplay and fun.

however (and thats a big however) , i do not recomend to buy this game because of capcom money sucking
strategy.

first they release this game ,half year later they release an enhanced game which contain few more characters
, steam blocked the enhanced game in my country so i had to buy a retail , after a year steam allow me to buy their
edition of the game.

in simple words capcom force you to buy newer versions of the same game every few months (just with few more characters)

and in some worst cases like street fighter x tekken they sell you incomplete game and force you to pay to unlock
game characters using DLC.

i think that when a person see a new capcom game he better wait at least a year for a better version with more content
instead of buying three games (street fighter iv,street fighter iv arcade,street fighter iv ultra edition)

reviewText:
Street Fighter? More like Get-Your-Face-Shoved-Up-Your-Own-‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•-Repeatedly-By-Someone-Who-Has-Five-Thousand-More-Hours-Than-You-Fighter.

Think I'm exagurrating? Go on then, give it a go.

Street Fighter has one of the most amazing learning curves in the world, right up there with the tear your own eyes out and put them in a blender to relieve yourself of the difficulty levels of even trying to GET INTO Dwarf Fortress, nevermind playing it.

So if you have a thing for getting beat up by some cackling kid who has played the game forever, go ahead and buy yourself some Street Fighter. You sadomachistic person you.

Good luck, and when it all inevitably goes wrong, I told you so.

reviewText:
Everything nostalgic and classic from SF2 while having all of the modern bells and whistles to mix into a great game.

Edit, I wrote this review on June 23 2011, and as of November 2013, the multiplayer servers are completely 100% empty.  People have moved on to Super Street Fighter 4 Champion Platinum's Turbo X2 Alpha Strike Collector's Limited Special Edition Gold.  Or whatever the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•.  All that's left here is GFWL achievements to single player.  I managed to get like 10/48, the rest of them are challenge mode.  You have to be autistic or something to pull off the combos.  I'm not talking about Ryu's Hadouken, I'm talking about some advanced ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• that you don't have the fingers for if you're over 8.

Bottom line, if you really want to play Street Fighter, get the new one that everyone plays.  Whatever that is now.

reviewText:
{Overt sarcasm} Just what the world needs...yet another overpriced Street Fighter game. Yay...

You want:
- to release some stress after a tiresome day?
- instant action, without leveling up or searching for enemies in empty levels?
- quick matches, when you have limited free time?

You like:
- martial arts, without weapons?
- fighting alone or in a team against other people?
- anime styled humor?
- fast arcade games, which require good reflexes and enemy stratefy prediction?

Then Super Street Fighter 4: Arade Edition" is the right game for you!

A modern classic. While a bit more glitchy than its console counterpart, the formula that makes the combat so dynamic and exciting is still present in full form. While it takes a while to learn the ropes, progress in this game is particularily rewarding due to the 'in your face' nature of the combat. There's nothing like pulling off an ultra at the right time and obliterating half your opponents life bar. Best fighting game on the block.
This game is beast! I'd really love Tekken on pc, but this is good enough.

reviewerDisplayName: I'm Yang & I am a plastic bag
reviewText: Shouldn't have bought this full release" it sucks ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• -.-..... compared to sf4 this feels like a reskinned SF x Tekken LOL.... so sad.... and the pace is so slow.... bad game..... make me cry....."
Obsolete and unsupported
DO NOT BUY. Online game not possible due to GFWL closure.

Somehow got matched against (and completely whooped by) someone through the Fight Requests function even though GFWL is dead and no one should be logically playing this anyway with Ultra being a thing.

That in mind had zero problems getting the game to run on Win10, likewise no problems getting around GFWL (you can still log in if you have a microsoft account, it seems).

Only real reason to get this version is if you want to see the animated arcade openings/endings, as they were replaced with different ones in Super SSIV and onward.

Coming back to this version of SF4 in 2016 is like going for a walk in a graveyard. And this graveyard is haunted by the spooky GFWL ghost.

Then I found out this game was re-released with GFWL patched out as a full price game called Ultra SF4.

Meanwhile, game company like From Software actually went to the trouble of patching Dark Souls 1 just to remove GFWL and add Steamworks support.

Some do it for the thrills, others do it for the money.
